topic.title: Getting zeronet running with tor
topic.body:
Additionally to the ControlPort stuff mentioned in the [docs](/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/faq/#how-to-use-zeronet-with-tor) you have to do:

`echo 'CookieAuthFileGroupReadable 1' >> /etc/tor/torrc`
`chmod g+xr /var/lib/tor/ `
`usermod -a -G tor zeronet`

if you want to use the ‘tor: always’ setting:

`echo 'tor = always' >> /etc/zeronet.conf`

… worked for me, had anyone have further issues?

1_1PVcdu7USZH2kHMETbqDYLPjJZKCDWM52k.body: we probably need to write an modified service-file which fixes the permissions

I got it fixed, I used a timer and modified the zeronet service (`systemctl edit zeronet`)

[here is the files content (NullPaste)](/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?1PVcdu7USZH2kHMETbqDYLPjJZKCDWM52k_0)

You start the whole thing with `systemctl start zeronet.timer`

1_1MahZJTzjoEMMCv2jBReDWhyNGRhN5tvDq.body:
I'm using for opening ports on my local machine's firewall. But since I'm using TOR now, it's not neccessary any longer.

    # /etc/systemd/system/zeronet.service.d/override.conf
    [Service]
    PermissionsStartOnly=true
    ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/iptables -A TCP -p tcp -m tcp --dport 15441 -j ACCEPT
    ExecStopPost=/usr/bin/iptables -D TCP -p tcp -m tcp --dport 15441 -j ACCEPT
